title: 'Time off and extra cash!': Long-standing employee uses their absentee boss's negligence to score a free 2-week vacation and still get paid PTO
description: PTO is sacred in the U S of A.Â Lost in the endless wash of vacation requests, paid leave, and maternity time, many hardworking employees don't even take their PTO, knowing the workplace would crumble in their absence. But rarely, and occasionally in the workingman's favor, PTO can be used against our negligent bosses, especially the ones who are never around.
author: Jesse Kessenheimer
excerpt: 'Time off and extra cash!': Long-standing employee uses their absentee boss's negligence to score a free 2-week vacation and still get paid PTO - The internet has generated a huge amount of laughs from cats and FAILS. And we all out of cats.
text: Bosses who are absent don't get to make the hard calls in the office anymore. If you're not around or not even present except during the occasional company meeting, how is your workforce supposed to respect your leadership? In a bad boss's absence, the hard workers of the world might just take advantage of the holes in the system, especially if that means cashing in on PTO they already used.This long-standing employee was nearing the end of an 8-year contract with a company. Tired of the endless bureaucracy and living up his boss's slack, he decided to take a 2-week vacation that ended up costing him almost nothing because of a system glitch with HR.
html:
Bosses who are absent don't get to make the hard calls in the office anymore. If you're not around or not even present except during the occasional company meeting, how is your workforce supposed to respect your leadership? In a bad boss's absence, the hard workers of the world might just take advantage of the holes in the system, especially if that means cashing in on PTO they already used.

This long-standing employee was nearing the end of an 8-year contract with a company. Tired of the endless bureaucracy and living up his boss's slack, he decided to take a 2-week vacation that ended up costing him almost nothing because of a system glitch with HR.
